snippet: The state A.F.L.-C.I.O. and two local unions filed a lawsuit Tuesday seeking to at least temporarily block a new law barring unions from requiring workers to pay the equivalent of dues.
abstract: Wisconsin AFL-CIO and two local unions file lawsuit seeking to temporarily block law signed by Gov Scott Walker prohibiting unions from requiring non-members to pay equivalent of dues.
lead_paragraph: The state A.F.L.-C.I.O. and two local unions filed a lawsuit Tuesday seeking to at least temporarily block a new law barring unions from requiring workers to pay the equivalent of dues.

headline.main: Wisconsin: Unions Sue to Stop Law Halting Dues Collection
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin: Unions Sue to Stop Law Halting Dues Collection

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Federation of Labor-Congress of Industrial Organizations
